article.headline: Columbia 85, Sacred Heart 79 (OT)
article.story: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- Matt Preston scored 27 points and Columbia went on an 8-2 run in overtime in an 85-79 win over Sacred Heart Tuesday. Columbia (1-2) led 37-34 at halftime and built a 54-45 margin with 13:43 left in regulation. But Sacred Heart (2-2) went on a 15-0 run over the next six minutes as Mading Mading blocked three shots and Maurice Bailey scored eight of the 15 points. Preston scored on a layup to give Columbia a 71-68 lead with 1:37 left in regulation. Mike Parker got the Pioneers to within 71-70 with a layup with 31 seconds remaining. Allan MacQuarrie put the Lions up by three with two free throws before Omar Wellington hit a 3-pointer to tie that game at 73-73 with 15 seconds left. Sacred Heart's Kibwe Trim blocked Maurice Murphy's layup try at the end of regulation. Bailey hit a layup for the first points of overtime before Columbia went on its run. Columbia shot 3-for-4 in the extra period, while the Pioneers were just 2-of-9. Bailey finished with 23 points and Wellington added 20 for Sacred Heart.
